com.googlecode.aluminumproject.context

Interface Context

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractContext, DefaultContext, ServletContext

    public interface Context
    A context that is used throughout the processing of one template.

    A context can contain variables. Each variable is stored in a certain scope. At the very minimum, implementations are required to support the template scope, though it's possible to add scopes. Scopes that are added can be removed as well.

    A context can have a number of implicit objects, which are not scoped. Implicit objects can be added and removed freely, although their names should not start with "aluminum". Subclasses can further restrict the names that may be used for implicit names.

    When a context supports it, it's possible to create one or more child contexts. The parent of such a child context can be obtained and will be used when finding variables.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String RESERVED_IMPLICIT_OBJECT_NAME_PREFIX
      The prefix of names of implicit objects that are reserved for internal use: "aluminum".
      static String TEMPLATE_SCOPE
      The name of the default scope.

    • Method Detail

      • getScopeNames

        Set<String> getScopeNames()
        Returns all scope names, ordered by priority (from highest to lowest).
        Returns:
        a set that contains the names of all scopes in this context

      • addScope

        String addScope(String name,
              boolean requireUniqueName)
                throws AluminumException
        Adds a scope.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the scope to add
        requireUniqueName - whether the name is expected to be unique; if it isn't, this context is allowed to change the name to ensure its uniqueness
        Returns:
        the actual name of the new scope: this will be the same name as was requested if it should be unique, it could be different if a scope with the requested name already exists and the name is not required to be unique
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the name has to be unique and there already is a scope with the given name

      • removeScope

        void removeScope(String name)
                 throws AluminumException
        Removes a scope.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the scope to remove
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when there's no scope with the given name or when the scope can't be removed

      • getVariableNames

        Set<String> getVariableNames(String scope)
                             throws AluminumException
        Returns all variable names within a certain scope.
        Parameters:
        scope - the name of the scope to retrieve the variable names of
        Returns:
        a set that contains the names of all variables in the given scope (may be empty but not null)
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when there's no scope with the given name

      • getVariable

        Object getVariable(String scope,
                 String name)
                   throws AluminumException
        Retrieves a variable by name.
        Parameters:
        scope - the name of the scope to get the variable from
        name - the name of the variable to retrieve
        Returns:
        the value of the variable with the given name in the specified scope
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when there's no scope with the given name or when there's no variable with the given name within the scope

      • setVariable

        Object setVariable(String name,
                 Object value)
        Sets a variable in the innermost scope (i.e. the scope that was added last).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable to set
        value - the value to set
        Returns:
        the previous value of the variable (or null if the variable did not exist)

      • setVariable

        Object setVariable(String scope,
                 String name,
                 Object value)
                   throws AluminumException
        Sets a variable.
        Parameters:
        scope - the name of the scope to set the variable in
        name - the name of the variable to set
        value - the value to set
        Returns:
        the previous value of the variable (or null if the variable did not exist)
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when there's no scope with the given name

      • removeVariable

        Object removeVariable(String name)
                      throws AluminumException
        Removes a variable from the innermost scope (i.e. the scope that was added last).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable to remove
        Returns:
        the previous value of the variable
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when there's no variable with the given name within the innermost scope

      • removeVariable

        Object removeVariable(String scope,
                    String name)
                      throws AluminumException
        Removes a variable.
        Parameters:
        scope - the name of the scope to remove the variable from
        name - the name of the variable to remove
        Returns:
        the previous value of the variable
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when there's no scope with the given name or when there's no variable with the given name within the scope

      • findVariable

        Object findVariable(String name)
                    throws AluminumException
        Finds a variable across all scopes. When multiple scopes have a variable with the given name, it's up to the context implementation which variable will be returned. When none of the scopes in this context contain a variable with the specified name and a parent context is available, the variable will be tried to be found in that context.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable to find
        Returns:
        the value of the variable with the given name
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when not a scope in either this context or one of its ancestor contexts contains a variable with the given name

      • getImplicitObjectNames

        Set<String> getImplicitObjectNames()
        Returns all implicit object names.
        Returns:
        a set that contains the names of all implicit objects

      • getImplicitObject

        Object getImplicitObject(String name)
                         throws AluminumException
        Retrieves a implicit object by name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the implicit object to return
        Returns:
        the implicit object with the given name
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when no implicit object with the given name exists in this context

      • addImplicitObject

        void addImplicitObject(String name,
                     Object implicitObject)
                       throws AluminumException
        Adds an implicit object.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the implicit object
        implicitObject - the implicit object to add
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when there already is an implicit object with the given name or when the name is reserved

      • removeImplicitObject

        Object removeImplicitObject(String name)
                            throws AluminumException
        Removes an implicit object with a certain name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the implicit object to remove
        Returns:
        the removed implicit object
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when there's no implicit object with the given name

      • getParent

        Context getParent()
        Returns the parent of this context.
        Returns:
        this context's parent, null if this context does not have a parent

      • createSubcontext

        Context createSubcontext()
                         throws AluminumException
        Creates a child context of this context.
        Returns:
        the new subcontext
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this context does not support subcontexts
